resume_markdown:
# DARWHIN GOMEZ

New York, New York | 347-491-2955  
Darwhin88@gmail.com  | [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/darwhin) | [GitHub](https://github.com/dw8888)  

---

## SUMMARY
Solutions-focused technologist with experience in designing AWS architectures, automated data pipelines, and agentic AI tooling that shortens feedback loops and accelerates application throughput. Proficient in Python and experienced in integrating machine learning models into scalable applications.

## EDUCATION
**City University of New York – School of Professional Studies**  
Master of Science – Data Science and Machine Learning, GPA 4.0, Expected Jan 2026  

**City University of New York – New York City College of Technology**  
Bachelor of Technology – Computer Information Systems, GPA 3.78, June 2024  
Dean’s List (8x), National Honor Society  

## CERTIFICATIONS  
- AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate  
- AWS Certified AI Practitioner – Generative AI  
- Google Cybersecurity Certificate  

## PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE  
### Solutions Architect Intern  
**Amazon Web Services (AWS)** | Arlington, VA (Remote/Hybrid)  
Jun 2025 – Sep 2025  
- Designed and presented secure, scalable AWS architectures tailored to enterprise client needs.  
- Developed proof-of-concept (POC) solutions integrating Generative AI (Bedrock using fully managed LLM models), data analytics (Athena, Glue, SQL), and serverless computing (Lambda) to discover actionable business insights from constituent sentiment.  
- Built and deployed a fully automated sentiment analysis pipeline processing over 1M feedback records, enabling 5× faster feedback-to-action turnaround through real-time Amazon QuickSight dashboards.  
- Fine-tuned foundational models in Amazon SageMaker using instruction training, achieving a 5% increase in output accuracy and an 8% reduction in toxicity and hallucinations.  

### Software Developer Intern  
**WOPLLI Technologies** | Remote, NY  
Jun 2024 – Sep 2024  
- Designed a Virtual Credential System (VCS) for decentralized identity ecosystems.  
- Configured and tested Azure environments for application hosting and deployment.  
- Developed API integration and testing scripts using Postman, ensuring seamless communication between services.  

### IT Support Intern  
**Mayor’s Office of Information Services** | New York, NY  
Feb 2024 – May 2024  
- Automated troubleshooting workflows via Python scripts to reduce manual workload.  
- Supported VIP users, ensuring secure system access (Active Directory, VPN, VOIP).  

### IT Instructor Assistant  
**RF CUNY & Generation USA (Choose-U)** | Remote, NY  
Feb 2022 – Aug 2023  
- Delivered 36 lessons on IT support, Linux, PowerShell, and scripting for 200+ learners.  
- Achieved a 96% cohort graduation rate by tailoring instruction with learner data insights.  

## TECHNICAL PROJECTS  
### Alfred: Personal Agentic Job Search Assistant  
- Designed and developed a personal agentic job search assistant using FastAPI (Python) and OpenAI GPT-4.1 Mini for automated resume and cover letter generation.  
- Implemented a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system using a PostgreSQL database with pgvector to store and retrieve personal work data as embeddings.  
- Established a CI/CD pipeline and Docker deployment for the FastAPI server and database, ensuring robust, tested, and integrated core features.  

## TECHNICAL SKILLS  
- **Programming Languages:** Python (pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch), SQL, NoSQL, R  
- **Cloud Technologies:** AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, Glue, QuickSight, Bedrock, SageMaker)  
- **Machine Learning:** Model experimentation, fine-tuning, classification techniques, regression analysis  
- **Security:** SIEM, IDS, Active Directory, Linux  
- **Development Tools:** Git, Docker, CI/CD  

## LANGUAGES  
- English (Fluent)  
- Spanish (Fluent)  

## PROFESSIONAL COMMUNITIES  
- Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers  
- NYC HackR – Data & AI Meetup Community (2024 – Present)  
- CUNY SPS AI Club – AI Research & Industry Presentations (2024 – Present)
